line.originaltext: 1/4 cup olive oil
8 cloves garlic, minced
2 1/2 teaspoons salt
1 teaspoon pepper
2 tablespoons ground cumin
1 tablespoon dried oregano
1 (8 pound) leg of lamb, boned and butterflied to a more or less even thickness, 4 3/4 to 5 1/2 pounds trimmed weight, fell and most fat removed
line.annotation: create_ing(ing6, "1 (8 pound) leg of lamb, boned and butterflied to a more or less even thickness, 4 3/4 to 5 1/2 pounds trimmed weight, fell and most fat removed")

line.originaltext: 1 lemon, juiced
Minced fresh parsley, cilantro or mint (optional)
line.annotation: create_ing(ing8, "Minced fresh parsley, cilantro or mint (optional)")

line.originaltext: Mix oil, garlic, salt, pepper, cumin and oregano; spread paste on both sides of the lamb and let stand for an hour until meat comes to room temperature.
line.annotation: combine({ing0, ing1, ing2, ing3, ing4, ing5}, ing9, "paste of spices", "")

line.originaltext: Mix oil, garlic, salt, pepper, cumin and oregano; spread paste on both sides of the lamb and let stand for an hour until meat comes to room temperature.
line.annotation: combine({ing6, ing9}, ing10, "lamb with paste", "spread on both sides")

line.originaltext: Mix oil, garlic, salt, pepper, cumin and oregano; spread paste on both sides of the lamb and let stand for an hour until meat comes to room temperature.
line.annotation: leave(ing10,"leave out until lamb is room temperature")

line.originaltext: Adjust oven rack to upper or upper-middle position (depending on lamb's thickness) and preheat broiler on high for at least 10 minutes.
Adjust oven rack to upper or upper-middle position (depending on lamb's thickness) and preheat broiler on high for at least 10 minutes.
line.annotation: set(t0,"rack to upper position, preheat broiler on high for 10 minutes")

line.originaltext: Place lamb, cut side up, on a large wire rack set over a foil-lined roasting pan.
Place lamb, cut side up, on a large wire rack set over a foil-lined roasting pan.
Broil, moving pan so entire surface browns evenly, about 8 minutes.
line.annotation: cook(ing10, t1, ing11, "broiled lamb", "turning so it cooks easily, about 8 minutes")

line.originaltext: Turn lamb over; continue to broil until well browned on the other side, about 8 minutes longer.
Turn lamb over; continue to broil until well browned on the other side, about 8 minutes longer.
line.annotation: cook(ing16, t0, ing12, "browned lamb", "until well browned, about 8 minutes")

line.originaltext: Turn off broiler, remove lamb from oven and let rest for 10 minutes.
Turn off broiler, remove lamb from oven and let rest for 10 minutes.
Heat oven to 325 degrees.
Stick a meat thermometer into the thickest portion of the lamb; return it to the oven.
Stick a meat thermometer into the thickest portion of the lamb; return it to the oven.
Stick a meat thermometer into the thickest portion of the lamb; return it to the oven.
Roast for a total of 50 minutes to 1 hour, until thermometer registers a rosy-pink 140 degrees.
line.annotation: cook(ing12, t0, ing13, "roasted lamb", "roast for 50 minutes to 1 hour, until thermometer reads 140 degrees F")

line.originaltext: Check lamb several times after 30 minutes.
line.annotation: chefcheck(ing13,"check lamb multiple times after the 30 minute mark")

line.originaltext: If lamb gets done sooner, simply turn down oven to 170 degrees until ready to serve.
line.annotation: chefcheck(ing13,"if done sooner, set over to 170 degrees until ready to serve")

line.originaltext: As soon as lamb comes out of the oven, squeeze on lemon juice and sprinkle with fresh herbs.
As soon as lamb comes out of the oven, squeeze on lemon juice and sprinkle with fresh herbs.
line.annotation: combine({ing13, ing7, ing8}, ing14, "seasoned roasted lamb", "squeeze lemon juice, sprinkle herbs")

line.originaltext: Carve, slicing across the grain when possible.
line.annotation: cut(ing14, , ing15, "carved lamb", "carve across grain when possible")

line.originaltext: Arrange on a platter, drizzle with accumulated juices, and serve.
line.annotation: serve(ing15,"on a platter with accumulated juices")
